nodes.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I would switch lines 62 and 63 so ENABLE comes before DISABLE.  In this way, throughout the code the ordering will be consistent (you have ENABLE, DISABLE, and then USER_CHOICE).
@kostyaBoss You can remove the unused import on line 3.
@kostyaBoss You can remove the unused import on line 5.
@kostyaBoss You can remove the unused imports on lines 7 and 8.
@kostyaBoss I would suggest deleting lines 134-137.  It is correct since it is generated by the code generator tool, but it is out of scope of the PR.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -101,18 +102,53 @@ * Array = true maxlength = 1000 minsize = 0 maxsize = 100 * Allows an app to prepopulate the text field with a list of suggested or completed entry as the user types. Set to an empty array to remove the auto-complete list from the screen * + * + * maskInputCharacters + * KeyboardInputMask + * Allows an app to mask entered characters on HMI + * N + * + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * + * + * customizeKeys + * List + * Array of special characters to show in customizable Keys.If omitted, keyboard will showdefault special characters + * N + * {"array_min_size": 1, "array_max_size": 10, "string_min_length": 1, "string_max_length": 1} + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * * * - * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0 + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0 */ public class KeyboardProperties extends RPCStruct { public static final String KEY_KEYPRESS_MODE = "keypressMode"; public static final String KEY_KEYBOARD_LAYOUT = "keyboardLayout"; public static final String KEY_LIMITED_CHARACTER_LIST = "limitedCharacterList"; + /** + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0

nodes.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I would suggest deleting lines140-142.  It is correct since it is generated by the code generator tool, but it is out of scope of the PR.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -101,18 +102,53 @@ * Array = true maxlength = 1000 minsize = 0 maxsize = 100 * Allows an app to prepopulate the text field with a list of suggested or completed entry as the user types. Set to an empty array to remove the auto-complete list from the screen * + * + * maskInputCharacters + * KeyboardInputMask + * Allows an app to mask entered characters on HMI + * N + * + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * + * + * customizeKeys + * List + * Array of special characters to show in customizable Keys.If omitted, keyboard will showdefault special characters + * N + * {"array_min_size": 1, "array_max_size": 10, "string_min_length": 1, "string_max_length": 1} + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * * * - * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0 + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0 */ public class KeyboardProperties extends RPCStruct { public static final String KEY_KEYPRESS_MODE = "keypressMode"; public static final String KEY_KEYBOARD_LAYOUT = "keyboardLayout"; public static final String KEY_LIMITED_CHARACTER_LIST = "limitedCharacterList"; + /** + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0 + * @deprecated in SmartDeviceLink 6.0.0 + */ @Deprecated public static final String KEY_AUTO_COMPLETE_TEXT = "autoCompleteText"; + /**

nodes.bodyText:
@kostyaBoss Lines 312-359 are good.  I would suggest removing anything unrelated to this that you have added.
(For example lines 303-306, 290-293, etc.).
@kostyaBoss On line 471 I would rename this to GENERAL_KEYBOARD_INPUT_MASK

@kostyaBoss On line 102 in the if statement you need to add: || key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_CUSTOMIZE_KEYS) as a clause in the conditional.
So the if would look like: if (key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_LIMITED_CHARACTER_LIST) || key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_AUTO_COMPLETE_LIST) || key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_CUSTOMIZE_KEYS))
@kostyaBoss Lines 61-68 are good.  You can revert the other formatting changes in this file, since they don't relate to the PR.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,35 +30,42 @@
  * POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
  */
 package com.smartdevicelink.proxy.rpc.enums;
-
 /**
  * Enumeration listing possible keyboard events.
+ * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0
  */
 public enum KeyboardEvent {
-    /**
-     * The use has pressed the keyboard key (applies to both SINGLE_KEYPRESS and RESEND_CURRENT_ENTRY modes).
-     */
+	/** The use has pressed the keyboard key (applies to both SINGLE_KEYPRESS and RESEND_CURRENT_ENTRY modes).
+	 *
+	 */
 
     KEYPRESS,
-    /**
-     * The User has finished entering text from the keyboard and submitted the entry.
+    /** The User has finished entering text from the keyboard and submitted the entry.
+     *
      */
 
     ENTRY_SUBMITTED,
-    /**
-     * The User has pressed the HMI-defined "Cancel" button.
+    /** The User has pressed the HMI-defined "Cancel" button.
+     *
      */
 
     ENTRY_CANCELLED,
-    /**
-     * The User has not finished entering text and the keyboard is aborted with the event of higher priority.
+    /** The User has not finished entering text and the keyboard is aborted with the event of higher priority.
+     *
      */
     ENTRY_ABORTED,
     /**
      * @since SmartDeviceLink 4.0
      */
     ENTRY_VOICE,
-    ;
+    /**

nodes.bodyText: @kostyaBoss So I went through the KeyboardCapabilities.java file and the only differences I see is (when comparing my generated file with yours) is in a few places you have added the @ s i n c e SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 where the generator didn't generate it.  I think this is okay.  You don't need to change anything.

I think this is okay.  You don't need to change anything.

nodes.bodyText: @kostyaBoss Do you need to uncomment lines 81-91 for the KEY_SUPPORTED_KEYBOARD_LAYOUTS?
@santanamk, thanks for bringing this up. I will delete, the layouts test case is covered by the final else branch
@kostyaBoss Do you need this comment on line 51?
@kostyaBoss On line 3944 I would rename the parameters to keyboardCapabilities1 and keyboardCapabilities2.
@kostyaBoss I would rename the function on line 3944 to validateKeyboardCapabilities.
@kostyaBoss On line 88 I would rename this to onKeyboardInputMaskHasChanged().
@kostyaBoss Since these enums were most recently added I would move the else if block on lines 341-342 below the last else if (around lines 362-363).
@kostyaBoss Do the unit tests in PresentChoiceSetOperationTests.java need to be updated?

@santanamk there were no tests covering the mask previously so I didn't add some new ones. To my mind, the PresentChoiceSetOperationTests are more about thread-safe testing, but we are not introducing some major changes at this point, so I don't think we should push the changes. Please, let me know if you still think we need to update them
@kostyaBoss Since these enums were most recently added I would move the else if block on lines 287-288 below the last else if (around line 310).
@kostyaBoss Do the unit tests in PresentKeyboardOperationTests.java need to be updated?

@santhanamk there were no tests covering the mask previously so I didn't add some new ones. To my mind, the PresentChoiceSetOperationTests are more about thread-safe testing, but we are not introducing some major changes at this point, so I don't think we should push the changes. Please, let me know if you still think we need to update them
@kostyaBoss On line 551 you are checking if getMaskInputCharactersSupported () != null .  However, that method returns a Boolean.  Do you need to change this logic?

I don't think so, because according to the proposal this is not a mandatory field, as far as I can remember, this means that calling getMaskInputCharactersSupported may produce NPE. That was the reason for this additional check
@kostyaBoss Do you need to update the unit tests?

I don't think the ChoiceSetManagerTests is testing what's going on it it's DisplayCapabilityListener at least I didn't find it in the current tests and it seems to be never testing before. If we still need to add those tests - let me know
This import is unused
Can we remove the todo?

nodes.bodyText: You shouldn't rewrite the whole class. Please revert the changes and  only modify the lines that are affected by the proposal
Can we rename this to onKeyboardDidUpdateInputMask to align with iOS?

After checking the proposal, I think that this is missing Android and iOS changes # 4. Here's how I think that would work:

The manager needs to handle what happens if the keyboard properties that the developer is trying to use are not supported.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use an unsupported KeyboardLayout, the operation will need to fail with an error log.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use uses too many customKeys for the current layout, we will shorten the amount they send to be the maximum amount and print a warning log.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use uses a customKeys array that is empty, we will remove the array to nil.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use uses maskInputCharacters when that is not supported on the current layout, we will remove the property to nil.
If the KeyboardCapabilities are not available, use the existing behavior of sending whatever the developer set.
Note that KeyboardProperties can be passed by developer in both setKeyboardConfiguration() && presentKeyboard() so we need to make sure that the properties are handled properly in both places.
The indentation doesn't look correct here

nodes.bodyText: Please remove all unused imports
Can we create that var at the beginning of the method and reuse it instead of keep getting that value in multiple places?
if KeyboardCapabilities is null, we shouldn't use the default capabilities, we should still use what the developer passes but assume that masking and custom keys are not supported.
Also defaultMainWindowCapability may be null so we should check for that.
I don't think you mean to change the capability here. I think you meant to change the configuration instead.
That var doesn't seem to be set anywhere
We shouldn't modify the keyboardConfiguration that the developer passes. If masking is not supported just don't set it in the properties object instead.
Similar thing applies to keyboardConfiguration.setCustomKeys(customKeys);
As stated previously,  If the KeyboardProperties that the developer sets is attempting to use an unsupported KeyboardLayout, the operation will need to fail with an error log.
if customKeyboardConfig != null, The customKeyboardConfig will be passed without checking them against the keyboard capability which is not correct.

Now there are more cells than what exists in the table header. They need to match with the header as the following This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Also please add unit tests to test the newly added manager code.
